717804f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - Fort Washington Avenue
717804f-a.text:
Broadway from, but not including, Fort Washington Avenue, to and
including Dyckman Street. The frame house on the right and the brick
house in the centre will be demolished around 1934, when all the
land shown on the west side of Broadway will become part of the newly-
created Fort Tryon Park. On the east side, the first street seen is
Nagle Avenue, with Sherman Avenue the next street north.
November 23, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
717804f-a.folder: Broadway & Fort Washington Avenue, Manhattan, NY

715702f-a.title: Manhattan: 159th Street (West) - Broadway
715702f-a.text:
570 West 159th Street, adjoining the S.E. corner of Broadway.
1932.
J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York.
Negative No. 24
CREDIT LINE IMPERArIVE ON ALL REPRODUCTIONS.

717757f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - Fort Washington Avenue
717757f-a.text:
The rear of a frame house on the west side of Broadway, north
of Fort Washington Avenue. This house will be demolished in 1934
in the creation of Fort Tryon Park, when the northern section of
Fort Washington Avenue, including its second intersection with
Broadway, will be closed.
November 22, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
